speaker: HELENA
text_entry: SCENE V. Paris. The KING's palace.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Enter LAFEU and BERTRAM

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: But I hope your lordship thinks not him a soldier.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Yes, my lord, and of very valiant approof.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: You have it from his own deliverance.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: And by other warranted testimony.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Then my dial goes not true: I took this lark for a bunting.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: I do assure you, my lord, he is very great in

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: knowledge and accordingly valiant.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: I have then sinned against his experience and

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: transgressed against his valour; and my state that

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: way is dangerous, since I cannot yet find in my

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: heart to repent. Here he comes: I pray you, make

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: us friends; I will pursue the amity.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Enter PAROLLES

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: [To BERTRAM]  These things shall be done, sir.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Pray you, sir, who's his tailor?

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Sir?

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: O, I know him well, I, sir; he, sir, 's a good

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: workman, a very good tailor.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: [Aside to PAROLLES]  Is she gone to the king?

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: She is.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Will she away to-night?

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: As you'll have her.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: I have writ my letters, casketed my treasure,

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Given order for our horses; and to-night,

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: When I should take possession of the bride,

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: End ere I do begin.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: A good traveller is something at the latter end of a

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: dinner; but one that lies three thirds and uses a

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: known truth to pass a thousand nothings with, should

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: be once heard and thrice beaten. God save you, captain.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Is there any unkindness between my lord and you, monsieur?

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: I know not how I have deserved to run into my lord's

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: displeasure.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: You have made shift to run into 't, boots and spurs

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: and all, like him that leaped into the custard; and

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: out of it you'll run again, rather than suffer

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: question for your residence.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: It may be you have mistaken him, my lord.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: And shall do so ever, though I took him at 's

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: prayers. Fare you well, my lord; and believe this

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: of me, there can be no kernel in this light nut; the

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: soul of this man is his clothes. Trust him not in

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: matter of heavy consequence; I have kept of them

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: tame, and know their natures. Farewell, monsieur:

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: I have spoken better of you than you have or will to

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: deserve at my hand; but we must do good against evil.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Exit

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: An idle lord. I swear.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: I think so.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Why, do you not know him?

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Yes, I do know him well, and common speech

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Gives him a worthy pass. Here comes my clog.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Enter HELENA

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: I have, sir, as I was commanded from you,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Spoke with the king and have procured his leave

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: For present parting; only he desires

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Some private speech with you.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: I shall obey his will.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: You must not marvel, Helen, at my course,

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Which holds not colour with the time, nor does

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: The ministration and required office

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: On my particular. Prepared I was not

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: For such a business; therefore am I found

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: So much unsettled: this drives me to entreat you

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: That presently you take our way for home;

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: And rather muse than ask why I entreat you,

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: For my respects are better than they seem

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: And my appointments have in them a need

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Greater than shows itself at the first view

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: To you that know them not. This to my mother:

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Giving a letter

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: 'Twill be two days ere I shall see you, so

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: I leave you to your wisdom.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Sir, I can nothing say,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: But that I am your most obedient servant.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Come, come, no more of that.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: And ever shall

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: With true observance seek to eke out that

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Wherein toward me my homely stars have fail'd

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: To equal my great fortune.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Let that go:

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: My haste is very great: farewell; hie home.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Pray, sir, your pardon.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Well, what would you say?

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: I am not worthy of the wealth I owe,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Nor dare I say 'tis mine, and yet it is;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: But, like a timorous thief, most fain would steal

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: What law does vouch mine own.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: What would you have?

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Something; and scarce so much: nothing, indeed.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: I would not tell you what I would, my lord:

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Faith yes;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Strangers and foes do sunder, and not kiss.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: I pray you, stay not, but in haste to horse.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: I shall not break your bidding, good my lord.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Where are my other men, monsieur? Farewell.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Exit HELENA

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Go thou toward home; where I will never come

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Whilst I can shake my sword or hear the drum.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Away, and for our flight.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Bravely, coragio!

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Exeunt
